intro: Lightfootia madagascariensis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth lightfootia, is a herbaceous plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glabrous, or smooth, leaf surface. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape and may have a glossy appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the Rubiaceae family.
